entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French liberté, from Latin libertat-, libertas, from liber free liberal

def.dt: :the quality or state of being free:
:the power to do as one pleases
:freedom from physical restraint
:freedom from arbitrary or despotic control
:the positive enjoyment of various social, political, or economic rights and privileges
:the power of choice
:a right or immunity enjoyed by prescription or by grant :privilege
:permission especially to go freely within specified limits
:an action going beyond normal limits: as
:a breach of etiquette or propriety :familiarity
:risk chance took foolish liberties with his health
:a violation of rules or a deviation from standard practice
:a distortion of fact
:a short authorized absence from naval duty usually for less than 48 hours
:free
:at leisure :unoccupied
city NW Missouri NNE of Kansas City pop 26,232
:a close-fitting conical cap used as a symbol of liberty by the French revolutionists and in the United States before 1800
:a tall flagstaff surmounted by a liberty cap or the flag of a republic and set up as a symbol of liberty
island SE New York in Upper New York Bay; comprises Statue of Liberty National Monument

:freedom from arbitrary governmental interference (as with the right of free speech) specifically by denial of governmental power and in the United States especially as guaranteed by the Bill of Rights usually used in plural
:a large copper statue of a woman holding a torch aloft in her right hand located on Liberty Island in New York harbor
:a trick play in football in which the ballcarrier takes the ball from the raised hand of a teammate who is faking a pass
